comment.author: 25634208@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney Harbour Bridge, and we'd love to have this added to the group! -- Seen in your Sydney Harbour Bridge set. (?)

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Thanks so much to Tony Browne for providing us with additional information about the kids in this photo. 
From Tony Browne:
"The  89 year old  lady next door   said  she  was  at the opening of the  Sydney  Harbor  bridge and  a  paper  took a  picture and  she  was  in the  paper.  I did  a search and found this  picture. When I showed her  she  remembered  and all her memories  of  the  day  came back. She  was  very excited  to see it as  she no longer  had a copy.
The   School  was  Bellmore  North . 
The  2  girls  featured  are Isabella  Watts on the  left  & Alice  Walker  then  now Oldham   the  lady next door .;80 years  ago.....she was 9 then."

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] A wonderful photo made even better by the identification of the school and the two girls. How amazing that someone found one of the girls! I love it when things like that just happen by chance.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hwmobs] The astonishing power of serendipity ...

comment.author: 49919647@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet]   After all that time - a marvellous bit of time travel, Ben.  The thrill of having a newspaper take your picture at 9 is ne'er forgotten! Thanks for sharing - both you and  NRNSW!

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Great story, and what a very happy ending that Alice has been reminded of this day so long ago.  Anyone know if Isabella Watts is still with us to appreciate the picture?

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/whatsthatpicture] The bridge has been bringing people together,in so many ways, ever since it was conceived. A great story!

comment._content: I haven't found the newspaper article this photo appeared in, but these are the stories that appeared in the SMH the next day, about the day 50,000 school children crossed the bridge in the rain - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16848641 trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16848676 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] I imagine Belmore North School would be interested ...
